page.title: 19ECOLOGY IN CLAYBROOKE
page.content: CONSERVATION OF THE SPINNEY A small spinney adjacent to the school was bequeathed this year to the school by Mr. Sykes, formerly of the Homestead. The Spinney which is in Trust for the school is to be used by the children as a nature area. Mrs. Wood, the headteacher, hopes to have the trees labelled, more wild flowers planted, and nest boxes put into trees. Leicestershire's Environmental Education Advisor has already visited the school to view the site. The Forestry Commission will also be involved in helping to create and conserve this area for the pleasure of future generations. Work has just begun this summer 1985.
